channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-16539] Add PTF tests for blobstores
item.description: This patch covers 6 tests that check the integration of several Partitioned Table Functions with blobstores

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12866689 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

juanrh Can you submit another patch to see if HiveQA works this time?
Btw, the tests are good.. +1

Hi Sergio, thanks for taking a look to the code review. The problem with this patch is that I have added a ORC file, and patches created with `git diff --no-prefix` following https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/HowToContribute#HowToContribute-CreatingaPatch don't work ok with binary files. I sent an email to dev@hive.apache.org about this, and owen.omalley suggested to use ` git format-patch --stdout`, which works ok when you apply the patch with `git apply` (HIVE-16539.3.patch), but from the message above it looks like Hive QA is not able to process that because it is trying to use `path -p0` or `path -p1` or `path -p2`. Can you please provide instructions to build a patch that includes a binary file?

Thanks!

juanrh I have used git diff -a --full-index in the past to make it work. If you use git diff --binary, then the smart-apply-patch will fail. I recommend you to test your new patch with the script to make sure it will work.

bash ./testutils/ptest2/src/main/resources/smart-apply-patch.sh <YOUR-PATCH>

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:

ATTACHMENT ID: 12868399 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

This time the tests worked.
Can I commit the patch?
Yes please spena, I was just waiting for the Jenkins queue. Thanks a lot for taking the time to review this patch!

I committed the patch to master and branch-2.
Thanks juanrh for your contribution.
Hive 3.0.0 has been released so closing this jira.
